summary: This document is a settlement agreement between Jeffrey Epstein, Financial Trust Company, Inc., The C.O.U.Q. Foundation, Inc., and Bear Stearns Companies, Inc. along with Warren Spector. It outlines the terms of a settlement regarding various investments and claims related to Bear Stearns, including allegations of fraudulent inducement and breach of fiduciary duty. The agreement includes provisions for payment, releases of claims, and confidentiality.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is one of the Claimants in the settlement agreement, involved in various financial investments with Bear Stearns.

persons.name: Warren Spector
persons.context: Warren Spector is mentioned as a Respondent in the settlement agreement, associated with Bear Stearns.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein is a claimant against Warren Spector, who is associated with Bear Stearns in the context of the settlement agreement.

events.title: Transferred Investment
events.description: COUQ transferred its investment in the ABS Fund to a third party effective as of January 1, 2008.

events.title: Withdrawn Investment
events.description: FTC's investment in the ABS Fund was compulsorily withdrawn, and FTC received an in-kind distribution from the ABS Fund.

events.title: Settlement Agreement Execution
events.description: The parties executed the settlement agreement to resolve claims related to their investments.

keyFacts: The settlement agreement involves Jeffrey Epstein and Warren Spector among other parties.
FTC invested a total of $15 million in Bear Stearns High-Grade Structured Credit Strategies.
The agreement includes a confidentiality clause preventing disclosure of its terms.
Claimants release all claims against Bear Stearns in exchange for a settlement amount.
There are several references to financial investments and legal claims related to Bear Stearns.
